page.title: 13Travel around Snape,Yorks.
page.content: The only public transport out of the village is the bus which runs each week to the market at Bedale on Tuesdays and Ripon each Thursday. Most households have a car, there are 124 cars in Snape and 14 motor cycles, used mainly for going to work or shopping. Sixty-eight people leave the village each morning to travel to work in nearby towns and villages. A coach collects secondary school children who attend school in Bedale. Another picks up students for college in Harrogate, at a point near the village. Snape is about 5 miles from the A1 at Leeming Bar and access to the country's major road network. The nearest railway station is 11 miles away at Northallerton.
